q: Eric Schmidt Steps Down; Co-founder Larry Page is New Google CEO Mark Hefflinger on January 20, 2011- 10:35 am. Mountain View, Calif.- Citing a desire to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility at the top of the company, Google on Thursday announced that CEO Eric Schmidt will step down, becoming executive chairman, while co-founder Larry Page will take over as chief executive. Sergey Brin , the company's other co-founder, will step down as president of technology

Laurence Lovejoy stabbed, beat, poisoned and drowned Waubonsie Valley High School sophomore Erin Justice in Aurora. Justice's mother found the 16-year-old's body in a bathtub of their townhome in March, 2004. He left her to drown in a pool of her own blood, DuPage County Assistant State's Attorney Michael Vick Pawl said during closing arguments Tuesday.
